Articles.Content:
It was not easy to pick a prefix for this thread.

http://www.plosone.org/article/info%3Adoi%2F10.1371%2Fjournal.pone.0037300

tl/dr: Walking on water is possible for humans when on the moon. This years Ig-Nobel winner in physics.
Quick! Let's build olympic sized pool on the Moon! Who knows - maybe this time stupid politicians will decide that finally NASA does have good reason to return to the Moon.
I found it cheaper to reduce water temperature to below zero centigrades and wait some days. Has the downside that the water become slippery and hard to fall on.
I find it easier to sit on a board (Which 2 people can get on! I'm looking at you Titanic) and float along.
Too bad it doesn't take the mass of a spacesuit into account. It easily doubles the mass of the astronaut.

Too bad it doesn't take the mass of a spacesuit into account. It easily doubles the mass of the astronaut.

You wouldn't be wearing a space suit, because you'd be using an indoor pool. An outdoor pool would begin to boil and freeze at the same time, which will preclude any running on the surface.
